TextBody:
Hello,

Before upgrading please create a VM snapshot to have a safe point to return to.
You can also check in "Appliance > Server Information" if you are under 70% space usage.
To update your server go to "Dashboard"->"Live Update".
If there is no "Available Updates" press the "Check Now" button.
Select the update and press "Apply Updates" button.(Please note the server version the update applies to at "Remarks")

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Sent: Friday, June 7, 2024 11:47 AM
To: S, Ramachandran Divya <divya.s.hn@hitachi-systems.com>
Subject: [!]Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411329 - - CoSoSys server upgradation [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BYYgs:ref ]

Hello,

After upgrading you can release the licenses from "System Configuration > System Licenses" to see if they are reassigned. Meaning the Epp client are still communicating.
After that you can update the Epp clients from "System Configuration > Client software upgrade".

Kind regards

Subject: [!]RE: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411329 - - CoSoSys server upgradation [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BYYgs:ref ]

Hello,

I can confirm the communication with lower client version is not affected up to 3 versions lower.
Meaning the Epp client from 5.8.1.0 will be sure to communicate with the server 900, 5910 and 5920. you can even push it to 5.9.3.0.

Kind regards
__________________

Netwrix Endpoint Protector

Sent: Friday, June 7, 2024 1:07 PM
To: S, Ramachandran Divya <divya.s.hn@hitachi-systems.com>
Subject: [!]RE: RE: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411329 - - CoSoSys server upgradation [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BYYgs:ref ]

Hello,

In most cases that is not a problem. Having under 70% usage is just a precaution.
To reduce the usage you can either setup the Audit Log Backup from System Maintenance or setup an External Storage to have the shadows and backups sent outside the server.

Kind regards
__________________

Hello,

I can confirm the communication with lower client version is not affected up to 3 versions lower.
Meaning the Epp client from 5.8.1.0 will be sure to communicate with the server 900, 5910 and 5920. you can even push it to 5.9.3.0.

Subject: [!]Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411329 - - CoSoSys server upgradation [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BYYgs:ref ]

Hello,

After upgrading you can release the licenses from "System Configuration > System Licenses" to see if they are reassigned. Meaning the Epp client are still communicating.
After that you can update the Epp clients from "System Configuration > Client software upgrade".

Kind regards

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Friday, June 7, 2024 11:17:55 AM
To: S, Ramachandran Divya <divya.s.hn@hitachi-systems.com>
Subject: [!]CoSoSys server upgradation [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BYYgs:ref ]

Hello,

Before upgrading please create a VM snapshot to have a safe point to return to.
You can also check in "Appliance > Server Information" if you are under 70% space usage.
To update your server go to "Dashboard"->"Live Update".
If there is no "Available Updates" press the "Check Now" button.
Select the update and press "Apply Updates" button.(Please note the server version the update applies to at "Remarks")

Kind regards
__________________
Andrei Pop | Technical Support Engineer
Netwrix Endpoint Protector
